references.paper_title: Benchmarking neural network robustness to common corruptions and perturbations
references.reason: This paper establishes a widely used benchmark for evaluating the robustness of neural networks, which is highly relevant to out-of-distribution detection.

references.paper_title: A baseline for detecting misclassified and out-of-distribution examples in neural networks
references.reason: This paper introduces a fundamental baseline for OOD detection, providing a foundation for many subsequent methods.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces CLIP, a powerful vision-language model that has significantly advanced the field of zero-shot learning and OOD detection.

references.paper_title: Delving into out-of-distribution detection with vision-language representations
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant as it explores the use of vision-language models for OOD detection, similar to the focus of the current paper.

references.paper_title: Locoop: Few-shot out-of-distribution detection via prompt learning
references.reason: This paper addresses few-shot OOD detection, a related and important problem in the field.
